int _refCount

Detailed Description

produces Jacobian and forward kinematics expressions.

takes a smart pointer to a serial manipulator containing Denavit-Hartenberg (D-H) parameters and the Jacobian.

ExpressionMatrix JFKengine::getForwardKinematics (  ref< const robot::SerialManipulator >    manip,
const Int    n
) 
 

forms forward kinematics expression matrices A and T, using D-H parameters of first n joints of manipulator.

Parameters:
manip  smart pointer ( ref<> ) to a SerialManipulator for which the forward kinematics expression matrices are to be formed, based on the manipulator's D-H parameters
n  use first n joints of manipulator for expressions
Returns:
A 4 x 4 ExpressionMatrix containing transformation matrix T for the given SerialManipulator; + T represents the position and orientation of the nth link with reference to the base coordinate frame of the manipulator.
Exceptions:
std::out_of_range  exception, if no joints are specified or n is greater than the number of joints in manipulator

Definition at line 47 of file JFKengine.cpp.

References A, base::cos, Debugcln, Debugln, DH_AT, Exception, base::ExpressionMatrix, forwardKinematicsCached, base::Int, base::Real, base::array< ExpressionMatrix >::resize, setZeroIfNearZero, base::sin, base::array< ExpressionMatrix >::size, and T.

ExpressionMatrix JFKengine::getForwardKinematics (  ref< const robot::SerialManipulator >    manip ) 
 

forms forward kinematics expression matrices A and T, using D-H parameters of all joints of manipulator.

Parameters:
manip  smart pointer ( ref<> ) to a SerialManipulator for which the forward kinematics expression matrices are to be formed, based on the manipulator's D-H parameters
Returns:
A 4 x 4 ExpressionMatrix containing transformation matrix T for the given SerialManipulator; + T represents the position and orientation of the last link (end effector) with reference to the base coordinate frame of the manipulator.
Exceptions:
std::out_of_range  exception, if no joints are specified in manipulator

ExpressionMatrix JFKengine::getJacobian (  ref< const robot::SerialManipulator >    manip,
const Int    n
) 
 

forms Jacobian expression, using D-H parameters of first n joints of manipulator.

Parameters:
manip  smart pointer ( ref<> ) to a SerialManipulator for which the Jacobian is to be formed, based on its D-H parameters
n  use first n joints of manipulator
Returns:
A 6 x n ExpressionMatrix containing the Jacobian for the given SerialManipulator; n is the number of joints from the given SerialManipulator that were used
Exceptions:
std::out_of_range  exception, if no joints are specified, or n is greater than the number of joints in manipulator

Definition at line 142 of file JFKengine.cpp.

References Debugcln, Debugln, DH_J, Exception, base::ExpressionMatrix, getForwardKinematics, base::Int, J, JCached, and T.

ExpressionMatrix JFKengine::getJacobian (  ref< const robot::SerialManipulator >    manip ) 
 

forms Jacobian expression, using D-H parameters of all joints of manipulator.

Parameters:
manip  smart pointer ( ref<> ) to a SerialManipulator for which the Jacobian is to be formed, based on its D-H parameters
Returns:
A 6 x n ExpressionMatrix containing the Jacobian for the given SerialManipulator; + n is the number of joints in the given SerialManipulator
Exceptions:
std::out_of_range  exception, if no joints are specified in manipulator

const Vector &    jointValue
) 
 

evaluates the forward kinematics expressions to return the joint locations.

If forward kinematics have not already been

Parameters:
manip  smart pointer ( ref<> ) to a SerialManipulator for which the forward kinematics expressions are to be used, based on its D-H parameters
jointValue  array of Reals; jointValue[0] is the value of the variable for the first joint
Returns:
loc array of [x,y,z] Vectors that give the location of each joint

Real robot::control::ikor::JFKengine::setZeroIfNearZero (  const Real    arg,
const Real    eps = base::epsilon
)  const [inline, protected]
 

tests for zero and returns a value of zero, if arg is within epsilon of zero.

Parameters:
arg  Real number to be tested for being close to zero
eps  the deviation from zero to be allowed
Returns:
arg if |arg| >= epsilon
0 if |arg| < epsilon

bool base::Referenced::unreference (    )  const [inline, inherited]
 

decrement the reference count by one, indicating that a pointer to this object is referencing it. If the refence count goes to zero, it is assumed that this object is nolonger referenced and is automatically deleted.
